intro: Moronobea globulifera, commonly known as the globular moronobea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, fleshy fruits that resemble small globes, hence its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and stamens.
